task.title: Using Keyboard Shortcuts
task.shortdesc: All computers have keyboard shortcuts that help users save time.

context.p: Though there are hundreds of keyboard shortcuts that can be used, we will focus on a few simple ones that you may find especially beneficial when working between Gmail and Microsoft Word.

step.cmd: If you are trying to locate a certain word or subject on a website or document, you can find it by pressing Cmd and F simultaneously on your keyboard, typing the keywords you are trying to find, and pressing Return. Scroll down the page to see all of the results highlighted in yellow.
If you want to copy text or photos that you find when browsing the Internet, select and highlight the item(s) with your mouse and press Cmd and C simultaneously on your keyboard.
step.info: Your copied text or photo will stay copied until you copy something else or reset your computer.

step.cmd: If you want to place that information somewhere else, go to anywhere you are able to type text and paste it by pressing Cmd and V simultaneously on your keyboard.
If you would like to copy text or photos that you have typed but delete them at the same time, select the item(s) and cut by pressing Cmd and X simultaneously on your keyboard.
If you delete something by accident, you can undo that action by pressing Cmd and Z simultaneously on your keyboard.
If you decide that you want to reverse your undo, you can redo that action by pressing Cmd, Shift, and Z simultaneously on your keyboard.
